key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#0
key.value: ## BASIC OPENDKIM CONFIGURATION FILE

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#1
key.value: ## See opendkim.conf(5) or /usr/share/doc/opendkim/opendkim.conf.sample for more

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#3
key.value: ## BEFORE running OpenDKIM you must:

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#5
key.value: ## - make your MTA (Postfix, Sendmail, etc.) aware of OpenDKIM

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#6
key.value: ## - generate keys for your domain (if signing)

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#7
key.value: ## - edit your DNS records to publish your public keys (if signing)

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#9
key.value: ## See /usr/share/doc/opendkim/INSTALL for detailed instructions.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_11
key.value: ## DEPRECATED CONFIGURATION OPTIONS

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_13
key.value: ## The following configuration options are no longer valid. They should be

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_14
key.value: ## removed from your existing configuration file to prevent potential issues.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_15
key.value: ## Failure to do so may result in opendkim being unable to start.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_17
key.value: ## Removed in 2.10.0:

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_18
key.value: ## AddAllSignatureResults

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_19
key.value: ## ADSPAction

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_20
key.value: ## ADSPNoSuchDomain

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_21
key.value: ## BogusPolicy

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_22
key.value: ## DisableADSP

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_23
key.value: ## LDAPSoftStart

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_24
key.value: ## LocalADSP

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_25
key.value: ## NoDiscardableMailTo

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_26
key.value: ## On-PolicyError

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_27
key.value: ## SendADSPReports

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_28
key.value: ## UnprotectedPolicy

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_30
key.value: ## CONFIGURATION OPTIONS

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_32
key.value: ## Specifies the path to the process ID file.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_33
key.value: PidFile /var/run/opendkim/opendkim.pid

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_35
key.value: ## Selects operating modes. Valid modes are s (sign) and v (verify). Default is v.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_36
key.value: ## Must be changed to s (sign only) or sv (sign and verify) in order to sign outgoing

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_37
key.value: ## messages.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_40
key.value: ## Log activity to the system log.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_43
key.value: ## Log additional entries indicating successful signing or verification of messages.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_44
key.value: SyslogSuccess yes

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_46
key.value: ## If logging is enabled, include detailed logging about why or why not a message was

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_47
key.value: ## signed or verified. This causes an increase in the amount of log data generated

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_48
key.value: ## for each message, so set this to No (or comment it out) if it gets too noisy.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_51
key.value: ## Attempt to become the specified user before starting operations.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_52
key.value: UserID opendkim:opendkim

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_54
key.value: ## Create a socket through which your MTA can communicate.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_55
key.value: Socket inet:8891@localhost

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_57
key.value: ## Required to use local socket with MTAs that access the socket as a non-

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_58
key.value: ## privileged user (e.g. Postfix)

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_61
key.value: ## This specifies a text file in which to store DKIM transaction statistics.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_62
key.value: ## OpenDKIM must be manually compiled with --enable-stats to enable this feature.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_63
key.value: # Statistics /var/spool/opendkim/stats.dat

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_65
key.value: ## Specifies whether or not the filter should generate report mail back

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_66
key.value: ## to senders when verification fails and an address for such a purpose

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_67
key.value: ## is provided. See opendkim.conf(5) for details.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_70
key.value: ## Specifies the sending address to be used on From: headers of outgoing

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_71
key.value: ## failure reports. By default, the e-mail address of the user executing

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_72
key.value: ## the filter is used (executing_user@hostname).

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_73
key.value: # ReportAddress "Example.com Postmaster" <postmaster@example.com>

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_75
key.value: ## Add a DKIM-Filter header field to messages passing through this filter

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_76
key.value: ## to identify messages it has processed.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_77
key.value: #SoftwareHeader yes

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_79
key.value: ## SIGNING OPTIONS

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_81
key.value: ## Selects the canonicalization method(s) to be used when signing messages.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_82
key.value: Canonicalization relaxed/relaxed

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_84
key.value: ## Domain(s) whose mail should be signed by this filter. Mail from other domains will

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_85
key.value: ## be verified rather than being signed. Uncomment and use your domain name.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_86
key.value: ## This parameter is not required if a SigningTable is in use.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_89
key.value: ## Defines the name of the selector to be used when signing messages.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_90
key.value: Selector default

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_92
key.value: ## Specifies the minimum number of key bits for acceptable keys and signatures.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_93
key.value: MinimumKeyBits 1024

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_95
key.value: ## Gives the location of a private key to be used for signing ALL messages. This

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_96
key.value: ## directive is ignored if KeyTable is enabled.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_97
key.value: #KeyFile /etc/opendkim/keys/default.private

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#_99
key.value: ## Gives the location of a file mapping key names to signing keys. In simple terms,

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__100
key.value: ## this tells OpenDKIM where to find your keys. If present, overrides any KeyFile

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__101
key.value: ## directive in the configuration file. Requires SigningTable be enabled.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__102
key.value: KeyTable /etc/opendkim/KeyTable

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__104
key.value: ## Defines a table used to select one or more signatures to apply to a message based

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__105
key.value: ## on the address found in the From: header field. In simple terms, this tells

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__106
key.value: ## OpenDKIM how to use your keys. Requires KeyTable be enabled.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__107
key.value: SigningTable refile:/etc/opendkim/SigningTable

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__109
key.value: ## Identifies a set of "external" hosts that may send mail through the server as one

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__110
key.value: ## of the signing domains without credentials as such.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__111
key.value: ExternalIgnoreList refile:/etc/opendkim/TrustedHosts

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__113
key.value: ## Identifies a set "internal" hosts whose mail should be signed rather than verified.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__114
key.value: InternalHosts refile:/etc/opendkim/TrustedHosts

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__116
key.value: ## Contains a list of IP addresses, CIDR blocks, hostnames or domain names

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__117
key.value: ## whose mail should be neither signed nor verified by this filter. See man

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__118
key.value: ## page for file format.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__119
key.value: # PeerList X.X.X.X

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__121
key.value: ## Always oversign From (sign using actual From and a null From to prevent

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__122
key.value: ## malicious signatures header fields (From and/or others) between the signer

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__123
key.value: ## and the verifier. From is oversigned by default in the Fedora package

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__124
key.value: ## because it is often the identity key used by reputation systems and thus

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__125
key.value: ## somewhat security sensitive.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__126
key.value: OversignHeaders From

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__128
key.value: ## Instructs the DKIM library to maintain its own local cache of keys and

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__129
key.value: ## policies retrieved from DNS, rather than relying on the nameserver for

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__130
key.value: ## caching service. Useful if the nameserver being used by the filter is

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__131
key.value: ## not local.

key.name: system/configs/none/opendkim/v1/opendkim-signingtable/#__132
key.value: # QueryCache yes
